conclusion: Problem involves two small balls connected by a rod forming a dipole in a magnetic field.
Dipole is initially aligned with X-axis, has angular velocity ω₀, and center of mass at origin with velocity v₀ = 0.
Objective is to find minimal ω₀ for dipole to reverse orientation.
Reversing orientation means dipole rotates 180 degrees.
Lorentz force on a charged particle is F = q(v × B).
Both charges experience Lorentz forces due to angular motion.
Velocities of charges are perpendicular to rod and in XY-plane.
Linear velocity of each charge is v = ω₀ × r.
Positive charge is at (d/2, 0) and negative charge is at (-d/2, 0).
Velocity of positive charge is v⁺ = ω₀ * (d/2) * j.
Velocity of negative charge is v⁻ = ω₀ * (d/2) * j.
Both charges have velocities in the positive Y-direction.
Lorentz force on positive charge is F⁺ = q * ω₀ * (d/2) * i.
Lorentz force on negative charge is F⁻ = -q * ω₀ * (d/2) * i.
Net force on system is F⁺ + F⁻ = 0.
There is a torque due to these forces.
Torque τ due to magnetic field is τ = p × B.
